```{r}
library(dplyr)
library(tidyverse)
```
# read in files using more complete data
```{r}
unemploymentNew = read.csv('../data/unrate_quarterly.csv')
inflationNew = read.csv('../data/pce_complete.csv') 
```

# rename columns in unemploymentNew
```{r}
unemploymentNew = unemploymentNew %>% 
              transmute(
              date = DATE,
              unemployment_rate = LRUNTTTTUSQ156S)
```
# rename columns in inflationNew
```{r}
inflationNew = inflationNew %>% 
              transmute(
              date = DATE,
              inflation_rate = DPCCRV1Q225SBEA)
```

#combine unemploymentInflation and inflationNew
```{r}
unemploymentandinflation <- merge(unemploymentNew, inflationNew) 
```

# graph unemployment and inflation using all available data
```{r}
ggplot(unemploymentandinflation, aes(x=unemployment_rate, y=inflation_rate)) + geom_point() 
```
